title: Bug 11314 - Incorrect Package Name Compression
description: The issue relates to incorrect package name compression in the 'Replace package name fragments' preferences.
OB: In the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field in the preferences (Java Work in progress), entering 'com.ibm.foobar' results in it being replaced with 'co~.ib~.foobar'. This behavior contradicts the expectation that package name compression should only replace a fragment if the compressed name is actually smaller. For example, 'com.' should not be replaced since 'co~.' is the same length and contains less information.
EB: The package name compression should adhere to the rule that it only replaces a fragment if the compressed name is shorter while retaining the necessary information.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Using Build 20020214, access the preferences.
2. In the 'Replace package name fragments with:' field, enter '2~.'.
